intro: Argostemma laeve subsp. laeve, commonly known as the smooth argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are usually smooth and have a lanceolate shape, while the plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
